ygData.subject: Re: Monk Armor and the short end of the stick
ygData.msgSnippet: The Grass is Greener Syndrom has landed on us, has it?  It s all been said: No one class is best -- that why we group. I ve put a lot of time in other
ygData.messageBody:
The Grass is Greener Syndrom has landed on us, has it? It's all been said:
No one class is best -- that' why we group. I've put a lot of time in other
classes, but so far, I like being a monk best of all. It's always going to
be a personal preference thing. If you're unhappy, role another character,
but remember that no one class is really best at soloing -- some are better
than others, but all in all, I think we (monks) have a pretty well balanced,
kick ass class.


-----Original Message-----
From: Mike Lehr <mike@...>
To: EQ-Monks@onelist.com <EQ-Monks@onelist.com>
Date: Thursday, July 29, 1999 10:30 PM
Subject: Re: [EQ-Monks] Monk Armor and the short end of the stick


>From: "Mike Lehr" <mike@...>
>
>Naah dude that is wack.. On Fennin Ro Bodhi (The First EVER lvl 50 monk,
>Leader of Dragoon of A.....(sorry bod i cna't remember)) Anyways we have
>done MANY Nagafen and Vox adventures and he is pretty much ther eason why.
>He is able to pull out those Fire/Ice Giants in a steady pace so that we
can
>handle them easily. I feel i have something to look forward to when i get
>my monk 20 levels higher. Then my guild won't have to depend on the
>Dragoons for so much stuff (heh).
>
>Monks, Rogues, Warriors, none of these classes are made to really solo
>(although rogues should be able to) They need groups, in groups their
skills
>are magnified by such an amazing degree it is beyond comprehension. If a
>Monk has a smart cleric or shaman he can take mobs on that are 5-7 levels
>higher then him, just by being constantly buffed and healed.
>
>People that complain about monks being sorry were just not made to play
>monks they should play a necro or mage or Wiz (good solo classes) So give
>them a spin fellas!
>
>Thats all!!
>
>Broy of The Mystical Order on Fennin Ro
